long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The package ldc-phobos-devel does not contain std.experimental.allocator and hence code that tries to use that cannot compile. Additionally, it looks like ldc-phobos-devel is missing everything in std.experimental except for std.experimental.logger.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
I'm using the ldc-phobos-devel package from the Fedora repos. Output of dnf info ldc-phobos-devel:
Name : ldc-phobos-devel Arch : x86_64 Epoch : 1 Version : 0.17.3 Release : 1.fc25 Size : 8.5 M Repo : @System From repo : updates Summary : Support for developing D application URL : https://github.com/ldc-developers/ldc License : BSD Description : The phobos-devel package contains header files for developing D : applications that use phobos.
How reproducible:
There are two ways to reproduce:
1) "dnf repoquery -l ldc-phobos-devel | grep experimental"
or
2) try to compile any D program with "import std.experimental.allocator.mallocator;" with ldc2
Actual results:
1) The output of dnf clearly shows only experimental.logger
2) ldc2 prints the error: "app.d(1): Error: module mallocator is in file 'std/experimental/allocator/mallocator.d' which cannot be read"
Expected results:
The program should compile
Additional info:
Installing dmd from dlang.org and compiling the same file results in no compilation errors. Normally I don't use mallocator, but libdparse is required by ddox and it uses requires mallocator. This makes building documentation via ddox and ldc2 impossible.

This is probably something that's missing in the F25's rather old ldc 0.17.x. If you have the time, it would be awesome if you could try updating to F26 beta and testing the much newer ldc that's available there.
Yup! It works with the newer ldc in F26 beta.
